Key Arguments: The legislation threatens fundamental freedoms of thought, speech, belief, expression, and religion.
The government has overreached in the past, particularly in the public health arena, leading to misinformation and harmful consequences.
The proposed powers for ACMA could lead to censorship and suppression of dissenting viewpoints.
The legislation could create a totalitarian regime reminiscent of oppressive historical regimes.
Individuals should have the right to evaluate information and form their own opinions without government interference.
Main Themes: Individual rights to access and evaluate information
Notable Quotes: The right to think and believe and speak - according to oneâ€™s individual conscience - has long been held as an inalienable human right.
Such a potential reality presents a very frightening scenario reminiscent of the nefarious religio-political power that reigned throughout the Middle Ages.
Australians must still retain the right to be free to access and consider the full range of information communicated.
